extension.name: Conventional Commits
extension.configuration.autoCommit.markd:
Control whether the extension should commit files after: forming the message or closing the editor tab.

When `#git.enableSmartCommit#` enabled and `#git.smartCommitChanges#` was set to `all`, It allows to commit all changes when there are no staged changes.

And set `#git.postCommitCommand#` to `sync` to run `git.sync` after commit.
extension.configuration.storeScopesGloba: Control whether the extension should store the defined scopes within your workspace settings or your user settings.
extension.configuration.silentAutoCommit: Control that auto commit should be silent, without focusing source control panel.
extension.configuration.emojiFormat.mark: Specify which format will be shown in the `gitmoji`.
extension.configuration.gitmoji.markdown: Control whether the extension should prompt for a `gitmoji`.
extension.configuration.lineBreak.markdo:
Specify which word will be treated as line breaks in the `body`.

Blank means no line breaks.
extension.configuration.promptBody.markd: Control whether the extension should prompt for the `body` section.
extension.configuration.promptFooter.mar: Control whether the extension should prompt for the `footer` section.
extension.configuration.promptScopes.mar: Control whether the extension should prompt for the `scope` section.
extension.configuration.promptCI.markdow: Control whether the extension should prompt for skipping CI run.
extension.configuration.scopes.markdownD: Specify available selections in the `scope` section.
extension.configuration.showEditor.markd: Control whether the extension should show the commit message as a text document in a separate tab.
extension.configuration.showNewVersionNo: Control whether the extension should show the new version notes.
extension.configuration.editor.keepAfter: Control whether the extension should keep the editor tab open, after saving the commit message.
extension.sources.prompt.fromWorkspaceCo: From workspace configuration or your personal settings.json.
extension.sources.prompt.type.placeholde: Select the type of change that you're committing.
extension.sources.prompt.scope.placehold: Select the scope of this change.
extension.sources.prompt.scope.newItem.d: Add a new, persistently saved, scope. (You can manage scopes in workspace `settings.json`.)
extension.sources.prompt.scope.newItemWi: Use a new scope. (The scope will not be persisted added in user or workspace `settings.json` - Dependent on your configuration.)
extension.sources.prompt.subject.placeho: Write a short, imperative tense description of the change.
extension.sources.prompt.ci.accept.label: Yes
extension.sources.prompt.ci.placeholder: Choose do you want to skip CI run.
extension.sources.prompt.body.placeholde: Provide a longer description of the change.
extension.sources.prompt.footer.placehol: List any breaking changes or issues closed by this change.
